Class GraphPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPanel
                          |
                          +--it.GraphPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class GraphPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class represents the actual graph drawing context and its support facilities. Graphable objects are held in a collection that is automatically drawn to the screen when necessary.

The class automatically calculates the extents and scaling operations so all operations to the user happen in graph-space and are converted to screen space by this class.

The class user has control on how the graph looks by specifiying several different parameters such as backgroundColour, borderColour and various dimensioning values.

As this class is derived fromm javax.swing.JPanel it can be added to any suitable java.awt.Container object. It uses lightweight javax.swing components so it is best to avoid mixing this component with any heavy weight components.

See Also:

setAxisValue

public final boolean setAxisValue(double xmin,
                                  double xmax,
                                  double ymin,
                                  double ymax)
This method takes a 4-tuple of values for the axis values and sets accordingly if they make sense. If any of the values are wrong sense then the axis values are not altered.
Parameters:
xmin - the minimum x value
xmax - the maximum x value
ymin - the minimum y value
ymax - the maximum y value

setAxisValue

public final boolean setAxisValue(double val,
                                  byte whichval)
This method takes a double value and sets the corresponding axis parameter if it makes sense. That is if the value isn't the wrong side of the corresponding opposite value.
Parameters:
val - the double value to set
whichval - the axis parameter (XMIN, XMAX, YMIN, YMAX)

Parameters:
label - String to which the appropriate label must be set
whichAxis - which axis label is being set? XAXISLABEL or YAXISLABEL

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)

This method handles the drawing of the graph panel. It utilises double buffering for more efficient drawing and all graphs are first drawn to the back buffer before the final image is then blitted to the front buffer.

The order of drawing is done by first filling the border, and then filling the area that the graphs are to be drawn in the desired background colour. The axes are then drawn. Then, a translated context is passed to an enumeration of the graphs so that each graph can draw itself to the canvas.

If the graphs cannot be adequately drawn in the dimensioned window, say for it being too small, then no graphs are drawn and a suitable message is displayed until the component is of a suitable size for "meaningful" drawing.

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - the graphics context to be drawn to

getGraphs

public final java.util.Enumeration getGraphs()

addGraphListener

public void addGraphListener(XYValWatcher listener)
Adds a listener for mousetype motion events to the panel. The main use of this method is if some object wishes to receive location updates in graph space so that the mouse can be used as a cursor to get actual y = f(x) values.
Parameters:
listener - an XYValWatch listening object. This object has to have implement the XYValWatch interface
